title.value: Multivariate Time-Series Anomaly Detection with Contaminated Data
title.justification: The title appears at the top of the first page and also in the header of each subsequent page.
title.quote: Multivariate Time-Series Anomaly Detection with Contaminated Data

extractions.description: This paper addresses the challenge of unsupervised time-series anomaly detection (TSAD) with noisy training data. It proposes a novel approach called TSAD-C, which consists of three modules: a Decontaminator, a Long-range Variable Dependency Modeling module, and an Anomaly Scoring module. TSAD-C is designed to handle contaminated data where anomalies are present in the training set. Extensive experiments on three physiological datasets demonstrate that TSAD-C outperforms existing methods, setting a new state-of-the-art performance.

type.justification: The paper presents a novel approach and validates its effectiveness through extensive experiments on three datasets.
type.quote: Our extensive experiments conducted on three reliable datasets conclusively demonstrate that our approach surpasses existing methodologies, thus establishing a new state-of-the-art performance in the field.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on detecting anomalies in time-series data, especially in the context of noisy or contaminated data.
name.quote: This paper presents a novel and practical end-to-end unsupervised TSAD when the training data are contaminated with anomalies.

name.justification: The paper specifically deals with time-series data and methods for analyzing such data.
name.quote: Multivariate time-series data (MTS) are referred to as timestamped data that consists of multiple variables, i.e., for each timestamp, there are multiple values associated with it.

name.justification: The paper incorporates graph-based methods to model relationships between variables in time-series data.
name.quote: To this end, we represent ùíâ_(ùëñ ) as a set of graphs ùêÜ_(ùëñ ) = {(ùêÑ_(ùëñ )^ùëö, ùêÄ_(ùëñ )^ùëö)}_(ùëö=1)^ùëë ,...

name.justification: TSAD-C is the primary model proposed in the paper for time-series anomaly detection with contaminated data.
name.quote: We propose a novel fully unsupervised approach, namely TSAD-C, trained on contaminated data in an end-to-end manner to detect anomalies in MTS.

is_contributed.justification: The model is introduced in this paper and is the primary contribution of the research.
is_contributed.quote: We propose a novel fully unsupervised approach, namely TSAD-C, trained on contaminated data in an end-to-end manner to detect anomalies in MTS.

is_executed.justification: The model was implemented and tested in the experiments conducted by the authors.
is_executed.quote: In the test phase, observations with s above œÑ are detected as anomalies.

is_compared.justification: The performance of TSAD-C is compared with multiple existing methods in the experiments.
is_compared.quote: Our extensive experiments conducted on three reliable datasets conclusively demonstrate that our approach surpasses existing methodologies, thus establishing a new state-of-the-art performance in the field.

referenced_paper_title.justification: TSAD-C is a novel contribution of this paper, hence there are no prior references to it.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We propose a novel fully unsupervised approach, namely TSAD-C, trained on contaminated data in an end-to-end manner to detect anomalies in MTS.

name.justification: ICBEB is one of the datasets used in the experiments to evaluate the proposed method.
name.quote:
Specifically, ICBEB is an electrocardiogram database that
includes the normal heart rhythm and different types of abnormalities.

referenced_paper_title.value: An open access database for evaluating the algorithms of electrocardiogram rhythm and morphology abnormality detection
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper provides details about the ICBEB dataset.

name.justification: The paper utilizes PyTorch for implementing the models and conducting experiments.
name.quote: Our method and the baselines were implemented using the PyTorch deep learning framework.

referenced_paper_title.value: PyTorch: An Imperative Style, High-Performance Deep Learning Library
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper provides details about the PyTorch library used in the research.
